Award.AwardTitle: SaTC: NSF Student Travel Grant for IEEE CNS 2017

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This award provides travel support for graduate students to attend the 2017 IEEE Communications and Network Security (CNS) conference.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The major goal of this project was to partially support the travel expenses of selected students, graduate and undergraduate, to attend 2017 IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (CNS), Las Vegas, NV, USA, from Oct. 9-11, 2017. A Student Travel Grant Committee was formed. Applications for student travel award was solicited by announcing it in different email distribution lists as well on the CNS 2017 website. 20 out of 33 applications and 20  were selected and funded by the travel grant. Through this partial travel support, students were able to attend the conference and share their research agenda with leading security scientists. In addition, each student was able to attend each paper session and other events at IEEE CNS so that they could learn the state of the art technology and research challenges in the field of network security.

 

IEEE CNS conference is a spin-off of IEEE INFOCOM, a top networking conference, and has been positioned to be a core ComSoc conference that serves as a premier forum for communications and network researchers, practitioners, policy makers, and users to exchange ideas, techniques and tools, raise awareness, and share experience related to security and privacy. Students had an opportunity not only to present their work to world leaders in network security and get valuable feedback, but also learn about leading edge research of others, meet and interact with industry representatives many of whom are recruiting and, in general, network with peers around the world. Today’s students are tomorrow’s leaders. Providing them with an opportunity to enhance their skill sets is a direct investment towards a better future.
